column4: is sudo apt-get remove libc6 dangerous? i need to remove it to install 2.3.2ds1-20
is sudo apt-get remove libc6 dangerous? i need to remove it to install 2.3.2ds1-20
well, absolutely everything depends on libc so i wouldn't recommend removing it
how can i then install the correct libc6
if your system is working, you have the correct libc. why do you need an old one?
what is this program? if it doesn't compile, it's either broken or you're missing some libraries
then you should be adding those, not removing libc :)
how can i add them?
install build-essential for a reasonably sane build environment
i tried that
your program is not looking for headers from the right place. headers should be somewhere around /usr/include but your program doesn't know that, or your environment is not right
i have done locate stdio.h and it cannot be found on the system.
just install the build-essential package
build-essential:
that sounds very fishy. how are you trying to install it?
i used both synaptic package manager and apt-get (command line)
try "apt-get -f install" with no packages
0 upgraded, o newly installed, 0 remove and 0 not upgraded
good. now try "apt-get install build-essential"
i tried this, but it wont work, depends libc6-dev depends g++ (>= 3:3.3)
try installiing those packages first. personally i think either your system is broken or i'm not understanding you correctly
try packages.ubuntu.com. but if apt cannot install it, i doubt it will be easier by hand either
